gw.api.domain.charge

Interface ChargeInitializer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ChargeEntryContainer, InvoicingOverridable

    public interface ChargeInitializer
extends InvoicingOverridable, ChargeEntryContainer
    Configures and executes a Charge

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ChargeInitializer.Entry
      Configures one InvoiceItem on the Charge| configured by the enclosing {@link ChargeInitializer}.

      Producer that is used instead of the charge's owner as the default payer for the charge's invoice items Overriding Primary Commission Receiver is required at this time as well, as Agency Bill Charges must be earning commission on a Producer Code on their paying Producer.
      void setRecaptureUnappliedFund(UnappliedFund unappliedFund)
      Sets the unapplied fund that the recapture charge should credit with its InitialChargeTxn Note, this must be set if you are making a charge with a RecaptureCharge pattern, and cannot be set if it is not a RecaptureCharge pattern.
      void setWrittenDate(java.util.Date writtenDate)

      • setOverridingAccountPayer

        void setOverridingAccountPayer(Account newPayer)
        Account that is used instead of the charge's owner as the default payer for the charge's invoice items Makes the charge 'Direct Bill'
        Parameters:
        newPayer - The new payer to be default for the charge

      • setOverridingProducerPayer

        void setOverridingProducerPayer(Producer newPayer,
                              ProducerCode newCommissionReceiver,
                              @Nullable
                              InvoiceStream overridingInvoiceStream)
        Producer that is used instead of the charge's owner as the default payer for the charge's invoice items Overriding Primary Commission Receiver is required at this time as well, as Agency Bill Charges must be earning commission on a Producer Code on their paying Producer. Makes the charge 'Agency Bill'
        Parameters:
        newPayer - The new payer to be the default for the charge
        newCommissionReceiver - The new associated commission receiver for this Agency Bill Charge
        overridingInvoiceStream - the new associated invoice stream, if any
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if entries have already been prepared.

      • getWrittenDate

        java.util.Date getWrittenDate()
        Returns:
        Written Date of the future charge

      • setWrittenDate

        void setWrittenDate(java.util.Date writtenDate)
        Parameters:
        writtenDate - to be set on the created charge.

      • getPolicyPeriod

        @Nullable
PolicyPeriod getPolicyPeriod()
        Returns:
        PolicyPeriod for this charge, or null if the owner is not a PolicyPeriod.

      • getInvoiceStream

        @Nullable
InvoiceStream getInvoiceStream()
        Specified by:
        getInvoiceStream in interface ChargeEntryContainer
        Returns:
        the default invoice stream for items on this charge to be placed on. The item placement can be overridden by calling ChargeInitializer.Entry.setInvoice(gw.bc.invoice.entity.Invoice), but without any overrides all the items should end up on the invoice stream returned by this method. Returns null if the invoice stream has not been initialized yet.

      • setOverridingInvoiceStream

        void setOverridingInvoiceStream(InvoiceStream invoiceStream)
        Override the invoice placement of the resulting items to be all on the given invoice stream.
        Parameters:
        invoiceStream - to use for all invoice items for the new charge

        value - value to be stored in extension property
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if property reference is not a valid extension property
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the initializer has already been executed.

        <T> void addToExtensionArrayProperty(PropertyReference<Charge,T[]> prop,

      • setRecaptureUnappliedFund

        void setRecaptureUnappliedFund(UnappliedFund unappliedFund)
        Sets the unapplied fund that the recapture charge should credit with its InitialChargeTxn Note, this must be set if you are making a charge with a RecaptureCharge pattern, and cannot be set if it is not a RecaptureCharge pattern. If this requirement is not met, executing this charge initializer with throw an IllegalStateException
        Parameters:
        unappliedFund - The unapplied fund to give the recapture credit to

      • getRecaptureUnappliedFund

        UnappliedFund getRecaptureUnappliedFund()
        Note, this only makes sense if you are initializing a charge with a RecaptureCharge pattern.
        Returns:
        The unapplied fund that the recapture charge should credit with its InitialChargeTxn
